title: Ratio of government expenditure to gross domestic product ( GDP ) in Malaysia 2024
yAxis: Ratio of government expenditure to GDP
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Ratio of government expenditure to GDP, with a total of 11 data points. The chart has 5 significant trends.
The longest trend is slightly negative which exists from 2017 to 2014.
Differently, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2024 to 2022.
On the contrary, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2021 to 2019.
On the contrary, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2019 to 2017.
Additionally, the next significant trend is moderately positive which exists from 2022 to 2021.
gold: The statistic shows the ratio of government expenditure to gross domestic product ( GDP ) in Malaysia from 2014 to 2018 , with projections up to 2024 . In 2018 , government expenditure in Malaysia amounted to about 22.7 percent of the country 's gross domestic product .
